intro: Goekyighitia, commonly known as the "Turban snail," is a species of air-breathing land snail. It belongs to the family Achatinidae and is characterized by its large, spiral-shaped shell. The shell is typically pale in color with a smooth, glossy surface. The snail is native to parts of Africa and is often found in humid, forested environments. Its diet consists mainly of decaying plant matter and fungi, contributing to nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
